intro: Psychotria mapiriensis, commonly known as the Mapiri Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance.
